Hi,

cule_barca wrote:
> Can I use REST for login page?

A "login page" implies that you create a server side session to hold
authentication data and application state. Any subsequent request to
another server running your application would require your client to
login on your "login page" again to create an appropriate session.

In a RESTful environment, any request should be stateless and contain
all the information your application needs to understand the request,
e.g. authentication data. If you use RESTful HTTP (like almost anyone of
us here) you could use an HTTP authentication mechanism like Basic
authentication or Digest authentication to provide the needed
information to the server.

HTH,
Jochen
